Nonbreeding.description: American Avocets are taller than Black-necked Stilts with a longer upturned bill. They also have a white patch on the wings while Black-necked Stilts have solid black wings.

Breeding adult.description: American Avocets are taller than Black-necked Stilts with a longer upturned bill. Breeding Avocets have a rusty-colored head and neck while Black-necked Stilts have a black-and-white head and neck.
